itemDescription: British parliamentarian, Governor of Sierra Leone and radical reformer

wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Perronet Thompson (1783–1869) was a British Parliamentarian, a governor of Sierra Leone and a radical reformer.  He became prominent in 1830s and 1840s as a leading activist in the Anti-Corn Law League.  He specialized in the grass-roots mobilisation of opinion through pamphlets, newspaper articles, correspondence, speeches, and endless local planning meetings.
